intro: Viola purpurea subsp. atriplicifolia, commonly known as the purple viola or heartleaf violet, is a species of flowering plant in the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and violet or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to parts of Europe and western Asia, this perennial herb thrives in woodland and meadow habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. Its flowers have five petals and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
